result.execSummary:
The defendant William James Riess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

*Same conditions as probation.
*Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

miscConds.notes:
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
*Fine is set at ZERO.
*Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including a DNA surcharge.  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 01-01-2016 and additional payments due the first of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or a civil judgment to be entered.

*No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
*Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

*No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution, including syringe without out a valid prescription.
*No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
*No contact with the family of Tabitha S.
*No contact with Jessica K (DOB 6-19-1988).
*No contact with Park Motel 7273 S. 27th Street Franklin, WI.

*Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
*Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
*Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
*Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
*Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
*Defendant must attend at least 2 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month. 
*Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 12 months of probation.

timeConds.notes:
*Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments, AODA treatment. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  Defendant is to serve 6 months of condition time, FORTHWITH.  The other 6 months of condition time is Imposed and stayed and to be used if there is a positive drug test. 
*Court notes Condition time maybe served in Milwaukee County or a county where the defendant lives or is working, if accepted.

records.addlTxt: Order signed and filed. Copies mailed to parties.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Stark  Br 17 for review. os

Decision and Order Denying Request for Reconsideration, received and filed. tk 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Letter received from William J Riess, received and filed.
Letter in response to letter submitted by Dr. Glen and Marvel Riess.
Letter received from Dr. Glen and Marvel Riess on behalf of defendant for release on electronic surveillance.

Defendant William James Riess in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
- Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments, AODA treatment. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  Defendant is to serve 6 months of condition time, FORTHWITH.  The other 6 months of condition time is Imposed and stayed and to be used if there is a positive drug test. 

*Court notes Condition time maybe served in Milwaukee County or a county where the defendant lives or is working, if accepted.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Defendant must attend at least 2 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month. 
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 12 months of probation.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution, including syringe without out a valid prescription.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- No contact with the family of Tabitha S.
- No contact with Jessica K (DOB 6-19-1988).
- No contact with Park Motel 7273 S. 27th Street Franklin, WI.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including a DNA surcharge.  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 01-01-2016 and additional payments due the first of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or a civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant William James Riess in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Parties just recently received PSI and requesting additional time to review. Court grants adjournment for sentencing, case adjourned to 11-09-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing letters on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant William James Riess in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Case proceeded to plea hearing. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Court vacated jury trial scheduled on 10-05-15. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William James Riess in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Any motions due no later than 07-06-2015 by 5:00 pm.  Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 08-17-2015 at 08:30 am, and Jury Trial scheduled on 10-05-15 at 09:00 am, Branch 17.   Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Calendar call scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 05:00 pm.

Defendant William James Riess in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Brandon Wigley for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty. Defense counsel received discovery and offer. Case is adjourned for projected Plea and Sentencing on 6-29-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. Any motions are due no later than 6-29-2015 by 8:30 a.m.  Calendar call scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William James Riess in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Ron Dague for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Arraignment scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any illegal drugs.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (4-8-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant William James Riess in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
